1.text: Better is a dry morsel, and quietness with it, than a house full of sacrifices with strife.

2.text: A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.

3.text: The fining-pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold: but the LORD trieth the hearts.

4.text: A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips: and a liar giveth ear to a naughty tongue.

5.text: He that mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker; and he that is glad at calamities shall not be unpunished.

6.text: Childrenâ€™s children are the crown of old men; and the glory of children is their fathers.

7.text: Excellent speech becometh not a fool: much less do lying lips a prince.

8.text: A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it: whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.

9.text: He that covereth a transgression seeketh love; but he that repeateth a matter separateth very friends.

10.text: A reproof entereth more into a wise man than a hundred stripes into a fool.

11.text: An evil man seeketh only rebellion: therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.

12.text: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.

13.text: Whoever rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.

14.text: The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water: therefore withdraw from contention, before it be meddled with.

15.text: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just, even they both are abomination to the LORD.

16.text: Why is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom, seeing he hath no heart to it?

17.text: A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.

18.text: A man void of understanding striketh hands, and becometh surety in the presence of his friend.

19.text: He loveth transgression that loveth strife: and he that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction.

20.text: He that hath a froward heart findeth no good: and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.

21.text: He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow: and the father of a fool hath no joy.

22.text: A merry heart doeth good like a medicine: but a broken spirit drieth the bones.

23.text: A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom to pervert the ways of judgment.

24.text: Wisdom is before him that hath understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.

25.text: A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bore him.

26.text: Also to punish the just is not good, nor to strike princes for equity.

27.text: He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.

28.text: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
